model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Neighbors A: I just got back from my trip to South America. It was amazing!

[MEMORY]
User Description: Neighbors A is known for their exceptional organization skills, being able to keep everything in their house well-organized and tidy. They value being organized as it helps them save time and plan strategically, as shown when they beat a kid at chess with a special move. Neighbors A is also open to sharing their knowledge and skills with others, such as teaching the special chess move to a neighborhood kid.

Relationship Description: Neighbors A and Neighbors B share a close and supportive relationship, as they enjoy doing kind gestures for the neighborhood kids together, like buying candy to surprise them. They both believe in the power of kindness and community-building, and Neighbors B admires Neighbors A's organization skills.

Event Description: Neighbors A and Neighbors B took a cooking class together last year, showcasing their shared interest in learning new skills. They also encountered George at the store, where they exchanged friendly waves and decided to buy candy for the neighborhood kids. This act of kindness not only brought joy to the kids but also highlighted the bond between Neighbors A and Neighbors B.
